title: [Self-Directed] Core Concepts of Fluid Mechanics: Systematic Understanding of Bernoulli's Equation

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of fundamental hydrostatic principles, conservation of energy laws, and basic calculus
context.additional_context: Part of a science competency enhancement program for current practitioners, aimed at advancing theoretical understanding applicable to practical settings

learning_goals: By comparing and explaining the three main derivation methods of the Bernoulli equation, one can accurately interpret its physical meaning

When applying the Bernoulli equation to real-world fluid flow cases (pipe flow, aircraft wings, etc.), one can construct analytical models that account for essential conditions (viscosity, compressibility, etc.)
One can explain the energetic characteristics of the pressure term in the Bernoulli equation from the perspective of comparing compressible and incompressible fluids

resources: Computational Fluid Dynamics Simulation Software (e.g., COMSOL)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
